newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Sept 21-30 IGP-M index rises 0.07 pct.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Sept 21-30 IGP-M index rises 0.07 pct.

text.p: Brazilian inflation between September 21 and September 30 rose 0.07 percent, against a 0.13 percent drop between August 21 and August 31 as measured by the IGP-M index released by the Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV).
The IGP-M is composed of three other economic indicators.

They are the IPA wholesale price index, which rose 0.23 percent in the period, the IPC consumer price index, which fell 0.19 percent in the period, and the INCC national index of construction costs, which gained 0.12 percent.
The IPA has a 60 percent weighting in the IGP-M, the IPC a 30 percent weighting and the INCC 10 percent, the FGV said.
The IGP-M index, which measures inflation over ten-day intervals, is published by the independent research institute Fundacao Getulio Vargas (FGV).
